title: insufficient permission for adding an object to repository database .git/objects
body:
I am running datalad update on the root of datasets.datalad.org super datasets directory. It runs for a while, but then it dies when it tries to process `datasets.datalad.org/abide/RawDataBIDS/CMU_a`

```
$ datalad update -r --merge
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org> 
[INFO   ] Applying updates to <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org> 
update(ok): . (dataset)
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide> 
[INFO   ] Applying updates to <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide> 
update(ok): abide (dataset)
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/Derivatives> 
[INFO   ] Applying updates to <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/Derivatives> 
update(ok): abide/Derivatives (dataset)
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/Derivatives/ccs_nofilt_global> 
[INFO   ] Applying updates to <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/Derivatives/ccs_nofilt_global> 
update(ok): abide/Derivatives/ccs_nofilt_global (dataset)
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/Derivatives/cpac_nofilt_global> 
[INFO   ] Applying updates to <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/Derivatives/cpac_nofilt_global> 
update(ok): abide/Derivatives/cpac_nofilt_global (dataset)
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/Derivatives/dparsf_nofilt_global> 
[INFO   ] Applying updates to <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/Derivatives/dparsf_nofilt_global> 
update(ok): abide/Derivatives/dparsf_nofilt_global (dataset)
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/Derivatives/niak_nofilt_global> 
[INFO   ] Applying updates to <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/Derivatives/niak_nofilt_global> 
update(ok): abide/Derivatives/niak_nofilt_global (dataset)
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/PhenotypicData> 
[INFO   ] Applying updates to <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/PhenotypicData> 
update(ok): abide/PhenotypicData (dataset)
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/RawData> 
[INFO   ] Applying updates to <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/RawData> 
update(ok): abide/RawData (dataset)
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/RawDataBIDS> 
[INFO   ] Applying updates to <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/RawDataBIDS> 
update(ok): abide/RawDataBIDS (dataset)
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/RawDataBIDS/CMU_a> 
[INFO   ] Applying updates to <Dataset path=/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/RawDataBIDS/CMU_a> 
CommandError: command '['git-annex', 'sync', '-c', 'annex.dotfiles=true', '--no-commit', '--no-content', '--no-push', '--pull', 'origin']' failed with exitcode 1
Failed to run ['git-annex', 'sync', '-c', 'annex.dotfiles=true', '--no-commit', '--no-content', '--no-push', '--pull', 'origin'] under '/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/abide/RawDataBIDS/CMU_a'. Exit code=1. out=pull origin 
ok
(recording state in git...)
 err=error: insufficient permission for adding an object to repository database .git/objects
fatal: git-write-tree: error building trees
git-annex: failed to read sha from git write-tree
CallStack (from HasCallStack):
  error, called at ./Git/Sha.hs:18:15 in main:Git.Sha

pull origin 
ok
(recording state in git...)
error: insufficient permission for adding an object to repository database .git/objects
fatal: git-write-tree: error building trees
git-annex: failed to read sha from git write-tree
CallStack (from HasCallStack):
  error, called at ./Git/Sha.hs:18:15 in main:Git.Sha
```
It might be related to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/issues/1682 .. but I am not sure how to cure this! :(
